thread.title: Mississippi to receive $582 million in RESTORE Act funds
thread.title_full: Mississippi to receive $582 million in RESTORE Act funds

author: Frank Corder
title: Mississippi to receive $582 million in RESTORE Act funds
text: Mississippi gets millions for restoration projects The $582 million will begin flowing to Mississippi in 2017 under the Resources and Ecosystems Sustainability, Tourism Opportunities and Revived Economies Act, also known as the RESTORE Act. Congress passed the law in 2012 to direct that 80 percent of spill-related fine money levied under the Clean Water Act go to the states and communities that suffered the most damage. State officials havenâ€™t decided yet on final projects but plan to focus on improving water quality, protecting and restoring marine resources and buying land to protect habitats. Officials will seek public comment and host public meetings throughout the state. ClarionLedger Posted October 15, 2015 - 10:20 pm YallPolitics.Com now uses Facebook for comments.
